name: Hotel Phoenicia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: My daughter and I have just returned from a four night stay at this grand hotel. The Hotel is in an excellent position for exploring Valletta and the Island. From the moment we arrived we found all the staff friendly and extremely helpful.
reviews.title: Great Hotel In Good Location
Nice hotel, great location.
reviews.text: We had booked a Harbour View room. We were disappointed with our first room as the view was over the large Valletta car park with harbour views in the far distance. Before unpacking I returned to reception and was promised a move to another room the next day. The second room (415) was fairly small but well furnished with a good bathroom. I think most of the rooms are the same size. This second room had a lovely view out of the rear of the hotel over Marsamxett Harbour. There was no balcony - rooms on the first and second floors have small balconies. We didn't feel the rooms were large enough to sit and relax in. They were great for sleeping - comfortable beds and very quiet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: There's a lovely lounge - didn't like the piano entertainment on one evening - and a club bar which is very colonial in style.
reviews.title: Finally stayed there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We only ate breakfast in the hotel. There was a good choice of hot and cold foods.
reviews.title: wonderful yet again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Neville on reception and Saviour, the Concierge, gave us some excellent recommendations for dinner - Ambrosia, Malata, Palazzo Preca and Gianni. I will review them separately.
reviews.title: May in Valletta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 great weeks at this hotel, we had a harbour view room, which probably did make the difference. The staff were always courteous and professional. The building is fantastic, the pool area lovely. If you can get the B&B option, it's definitely worth doing as there is an extensive range available - we tended to skip lunch as breakfast was more than enough! The Brasserie is definitely worth a visit too, with great food and excellent service. Best of all is the location, literally a minute walk from the main street in Valletta.
reviews.title: Great hotel, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice building, old classical. Nice pool. Nice interior. We found the food to be mediocre. The rooms were nice, but the bathroom shower curtain and shower mat were full of mold. We were told the water was not potable. High-class hotel, but one can't drink the water?
reviews.title: Only acceptable...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a very good position, just outside the gates of Valletta and right on the bus terminal. The hop on hop off buses go from outside the hotel. The entrance is very impressive and the staff very helpful and polite. Our room did not have a very good aspect, but this is not surprising as there is a lot of building work going on. Beware of booking a pool view room as we were offered, the pool is quite a long walk away in the ground of the hotel and no rooms will have a view of it. The room was well appointed and clean and the service good. It is very 1940's inspired and could do with some updating to make it feel a little more current. Wifi in the rooms would be good. We only had bed and breakfast and the breakfast was very good, even free sparkling wine if you wanted it!!!!!! I would say that it is more of a 4 star hotel than a 5.
reviews.title: Our stay from 10th September - 24th September

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed three nights in September at Phoenicia being on a business trip and we certainly agree with most of the reviewers. The hotel is at a great location regarding the city of Valetta and the bus station and there are a lot of great restaurants within a few minutes’ walk.
reviews.title: A little old, yet beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had a room with a view (a fab one) on the 4th floor, where the rooms are refurbished, and it was spotlessly clean and immaculate. The hotel is an old building yet beautiful with an aristocratic air.
reviews.title: Great Location and Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very smart, elegant hotel, in a prime position in Valetta, where the emphasis is on excellent service. Our room (basic option) was spacious with excellent bathroom/shower facilities. Breakfast plentiful with good choices. Particularly recommended are the snacks in the Club Bar which were of the highest quality, especially the Caesar Salad.
reviews.title: Elegance and Style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed the gardens and, if younger, would have enjoyed the pool also.
reviews.title: Grand old lady in need of a spruce up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One suggestion: make a catalogue of the photos in the bar and around, and present an exhibition of them. Some of them are fascinating especially to the older English visitor.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel. The best base
Fantastic
reviews.text: Would we stay at The Phoenicia again? You bet we would!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, the positives: Hotel Phoenicia is brilliantly located, has lovely gardens and a pool and more history and charm than you could hope for in a country over-flowing with rich historic significance. The bar is particularly appealing and shows what this hotel could be like if spruced up to its former glory.
reviews.title: Comfort and Excellent Customer Service
Needs an update
reviews.text: Impressive at first. You walk into the lobby and see the large bar/salon.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once you settle in you begin to see the flaws. Rooms are smaller than average. While housekeeping crew was fastidious, the lack of space for the price is shameful.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel in a good location
Why have a "contact us" email if you don't reply??
reviews.text: Biggest reason to avoid this place is the restaurant. Service is very slow and less than cooperative. Condescension is not a trait that I admire. Particularly when the attitude is not warranted. Add to that the wine list fails in scope and variety.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a room with two small balconies (each with just enough space for 2 chairs) overlooking the approach to Valletta Gate. The beds were comfortable and the room and bathroom were meticulously serviced each day. The hotel operates a system which enables you to opt in or out of daily bedlinen changes as well as the more usual system for fresh towels. With windows open, some people may have found the room noisy; with ear plugs or with the windows closed we had no difficulties.
reviews.title: Charm and character and excellent service in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The public areas of the hotel are also well-kept and have a faded elegance. Breakfast on the terrace overlooking the fortifications was pleasant with a good choice of hot and cold food and Doc was very satisfied with the coffee. It is quite a walk from the hotel to the swimming pool through the pleasant gardens. The pool area is rather bleak looking with lots of sunbeds and a cafe open until 6pm with very friendly staff. Although there are benches in the gardens, for us the gardens and the pool were not places to relax and read within easy reach of refreshments.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved every minute of our week long stay at the Phoenicia. From being picked up at the airport by private taxi transfer to being waved goodbye by smiling staff we were made to feel really special. The hotel itself is a landmark building in a great location at the entrance to Valletta, convenient for a stroll into town but surrounded by secluded gardens. Like the previous reviewer, we were not disturbed by road noise either when in our room or outside by the pool, and although the bus terminus is nearby it is actually very quiet in the evenings. This is not a seaside hotel- it's in the middle of a capital city- and perhaps it is sensible to be aware of that if you are seeking peace and quiet when you book. Having initially booked B and B, we told each other we would just try the food once in the main restaurant and ended up eating there every evening, since there was great variety every night from a Maltese evening to an Italian evening and a Sunday barbecue- all beautifully cooked and excellent value for money with free wine on several nights! We can recommend the Club Bar with its great range of drinks, free canapes and amazing friendly service- in fact the service throughout, from the cleaning ladies to the waiters and concierges, was up there with the best we have ever encountered, and I am including the Ritz in London. We felt ourselves to be very safe hands indeed. Our room was just a standard room with no balcony (we felt there was not much point in sitting out on a balcony in a city hotel when there was a good pool and gardens) but the bed was huge and comfortable, with sheets changed on demand and a well-appointed vintage-style bathroom and you could adjust the air-con to your own personal preference. As for drinking water etc. in the rooms- all you had to do was ask and it arrived- anything from water to sticking plasters when the chemist was shut on Sunday evening. We did appreciate the vintage style and decoration of the hotel and in fact that was partly why we booked the Phoenicia. It is a grand hotel in the best tradition, we love Malta, a week is too short to see everything and we will definitely be back.
reviews.title: One of our best ever holidays

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just returned from a week long stay. Had a fabulous time and loved the hotel. From the outset the service was amazing. Reception, concierge, bar staff, maids were all really lovely. The invite to the drinks reception was a nice touch. Met by the HR manager and he was lovely and really interesting to chat to. We had a harbour view room and it suited our purposes excellently. Unlike a previous reviewer we didn't find the hotel or bus terminal noisy at all and spent plenty of time on the balcony. The standards of food and drink are really high and we enjoyed everything we bought. For me the stand out thing in this hotel, other than location and service, is that nothing is a problem. You just have to ask. Will definitely be returning again for another week. Oh and the beds and bedding are AMAZING.
reviews.title: Fabulous stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very impressive entrance and reception areas.
reviews.title: Old Glory

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Pegasus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: Our room needed to have the double glazed doors to the balcony closed otherwise the noise from the bus terminus was intolerable. In consequence couldn't use the balcony and had to have the air con running to avoid it becoming an oven.
reviews.title: Excellent; Almost 5 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The location of the Hotel Phoenicia is fabulous, five minute walk into Valletta town and 2 mins to the bus station. The hotel needs a good upgrade though - it is a fading beauty. The lounge area is gorgeous and the outdoor terrace great for breakfast. The rooms are small and basic though - stains on the bath, cracks, old hairdryers connected into a drawer, no fresh milk, no top sheets, terrible shower curtains that stick to your body and flood the bathroom etc. The ambiance is lovely and the staff helpful, I would recommend though that prices are lowered to reflect the 3.5 star standard. The pool is about a 7 minute walk down a long path so don't forget anything! Breakfast is great however expensive at 14 euros for a continental selection.
reviews.title: Great location, not 5 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: You can't beat the convenient location of the Phoenicia, right next to the bus terminal and the entrance to the City of Valletta. The lounge still has old world charm; and the Thursday happy hour for hotel guests was enjoyable. Breakfast was not exciting, but the terrace made up for the so-so choice of foods. The staff was courteous and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. I had a deluxe room with Grand Harbor view. I could see the Grand Harbor alright, but mostly the unsightly cranes at the docks, which is not something the Phoenicia can control. All in all, I had a very pleasant stay at the Phoenicia, but the price-quality ratio is not ideal.
reviews.title: Good hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel by taxi. The driver carried our cases up the steps and we took them into reception. The door was not opened for us . We checked in speedily. The staff were not welcoming or friendly, gave us our key and told us where the lift was. We were not offered any help with our luggage.
reviews.title: Certainly not 5 stars.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room, with a harbour view on the 3rd floor was average. I understand it was one of their refurbished rooms, but it was not particularly attractive or comfortable. There was a lack of drawer space and the furniture was of poor quality and showing signs of wear. Toiletries were inadequate and not what you would expect at the price we were paying, 650 Euros for 3 nights bed and breakfast. We rang to request a shower cap and we are still waiting for it, having been home for 10 days! They have a policy that towels left on the rail can be reused, but by the next guest? When my husband picked up his towel it was heavily stained with make up!
reviews.title: Pleasant stay; not a five star property
Malta holiday Sept 2013
reviews.text: The pool is a long walk from the hotel buildings through the gardens, don't forget anything. It is quite a pleasant area with a cafe, where the staff were very attentive and friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: As last time all personnel took excellent care of me and my family during our stay. We spend 5 days in Valletta and had time to visit the nice garden and pool area several times. Not only for a swim but nice refreshing drinks too.
reviews.title: 2nd time this year!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very happy return visit to The Phoenicia where the staff really make a difference. Nothing is too much trouble for them & they will go out of their way to make any guest feel valued. We would recommend anyone who wants service with a smil to stay there.
reviews.title: 5 star service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The position of this hotel is superb. Just two minutes away from the entrance to Valletta, the city built by gentlemen for gentlemen. The hotel itself is very comfortable and it deserves its five star status. People who lodge once at the Hotel Phoenicia cpntinue to go there each time they are in Malta. Its staff is very great too and it is very welcoming. From here you can reach everywhere you wish to go very quickly because buses for all over the island is just three minutes away. Try it for youselves and you will see that you will never be mistaken in chosing the Phoenicia Hotel for your holiday in Malta.
reviews.title: A Very Well Placed Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: I have just stayed at the very best Hotel on the Island of Malta, this started out as a business trip and soon ended up being a very restful and peaceful holiday indeed - I have stayed in Malta on many occasions but never at this most elegant and superbly run Hotel. My room was perfect, with every facility I required for my short but delightful stay. The food excellent; the hotel right in the heart of Valletta; paradoxically, a quite place with Gardens and Pool, just beside the Island transport hub....
reviews.title: A business or Holiday Trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Brian W T Plunkett Eversholt Nr Woburn -Bedfordshire
reviews.title: Another wonderful stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from our third stay at this historic hotel where we are always well looked after. The staff are efficient, professional and friendly. The breakfast is really good and very wide-ranging, with what must be nearly all tastes catered for. Our superior balcony room had wonderful views towards Grand Harbour and the Three Cities and over Floriana and the comfortable bed was about as big as it could be. TV had a range of viewing available including Eurosport, Sky News, MGM films, Discovery, History and various European language channels. Free Wi-Fi is available on the hotel's ground floor and wired internet connection is available in the bedroom at a reasonable charge. Efficient air conditioning kept us cool at night. The gardens are beautiful and extensive with lovely views and the swimming pool and its facilities excellent - I enjoyed an excellent sangria at the Bastion Pool Bar. The hotel's location couldn't be better, with taxis immediately outside, the bus station very near and the beautiful, interesting and historic city of Valletta within five minutes walk.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel with caring staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have very recently returned from this hotel after spending a week on holiday with my wife. We had a basic room (214) which was functional, comfortable with plenty of storage places. It could have done with a coat of fresh paint as seemed to be happening in the public rooms and under the rim of the sink and toilet mould was starting to appear as well as the grouting on the bathroom tiles. It wasn’t too bad but could have been better considering the hotel sells itself as a 5 star establishment. The bedroom floors were tiled for ease of cleaning but they a noisy and you could hear furniture being moved throughout the hotel. That said it was ok and we managed to sleep quite well. Other guests we met who occupied superior rooms considered them to be small and lacked enough wardrobe room so you have been told.
reviews.title: Pleasant but needs some work to update it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were stopping on a bed and breakfast basis and the breakfasts were excellent with plenty of variety. The gardens are tidy but a little walk away from the hotel but offer good views towards a local harbour but it can be very windy.
reviews.title: Old fashioned excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the hotel staff to polite and helpful, you will find as in Italy that a please and thank you goes down well. This hotel reminded me of Italian hotels so 5 star actually should read 4.
reviews.title: Charm and good service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is situated next the main bus terminal which has two faces, during the day it is bustling and full of people but late at night it is quite eerie with few people as is Valletta itself. The bus is the best way to get around with a day ticket.
reviews.title: Very good hotel but far from perfect.

description: 5 star luxury in Malta’s historic Art Deco hotel. Hotel Phoenicia, one of the leading 5 star hotels in Malta, is located at the City Gates of Valletta, Malta’s capital city and UNESCO heritage city. Just 50 meters from city gate, it is perfectly placed for discovering the historic walled city, feasting on Caravaggio’s paintings and exploring the magnificent harbours. The hotel also boast magnificent 7 acre garden. The island's central bus terminus is just meters away civing the possibility to explore the whole island by bus. A stay at the Hotel Phoenicia is an unforgettable experience. Our charming staff will ensure your every whim is catered for.
